intro: Centaurea zuvandica subsp. jelenevskyi, commonly known as the Jelenevsky's cornflower, is a rare and endemic species native to the Caucasus region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or dry habitats. The plant features striking blue to violet flowers arranged in a composite head, with narrow, linear leaves. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties in some species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
